pr_body:
This project was the part of GSoC'21. Completed by @zeeshanrafique23  under the mentorship of @olofk.

The RTL of  M-extension and changes made in serv are verified with RISC-V compliance tests. Follow the README to run the tests.

The parent repository of MDU can be found here: https://github.com/zeeshanrafique23/mdu.git

To run the serv with M-extension you have to add mdu in [fusesoc](https://github.com/olofk/fusesoc) core list, run this command to check the existing core:
```
fusesoc core list
```
and to add mdu as a fusesoc core run this command:
```
fusesoc library add mdu https://github.com/zeeshanrafique23/mdu.git
```

Now run this command to build the serv core with mdu:
```
fusesoc run --target=verilator_tb --flag=mdu servant
```
Add `--vcd` flag to generate `.vcd` file to see the waveforms.

For more details check this [Blog](https://medium.com/@zrafique/gsoc21-with-fossi-foundation-ff1c869daec8).
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 691935098, 'comment_body': 'Rename o_mdu_rs1 to o_ext_rs1 instead since this can potentially be shared between different extensions', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 15, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691936361, 'comment_body': "Let's rename o_mdu_opcode to o_ext_funct3 to show what the value comes from and that the signal can be useful for multiple extensions", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 17, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691938527, 'comment_body': 'I think that dat_valid will always be raised for MDU operations. Please check if we can simplify this expression to just `i_mdu_op & dat_cur`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 20, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691939552, 'comment_body': 'Since we have moved the MDU out from SERV, I think we should change the documentation to say that this parameter enables the interface for connecting and MDU', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 21, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691941652, 'comment_body': 'I want all outputs to start with `o_` and all inputs to start with `i_`. I also want the names to have either `mdu` in the name if they are MDU-specific, or `ext` if they can be used for other extensions. But not both. As I see it only the valid signal is MDU-specific so I want that one to be `o_mdu_valid` and then ext for the rest, e.g. o_ext_rs2 or i_ext_rd', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 24, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691944675, 'comment_body': 'Remove added whitespace', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 28, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691945142, 'comment_body': 'Restore removed line', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 29, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691945359, 'comment_body': 'Restore removed line', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 29, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691945866, 'comment_body': 'Enables interface for RISC-V standard M-extension', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 30, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691946557, 'comment_body': "Use [ ] instead of { }. I actually didn't know it was allowed to use { }. Seems to work fine but made me a bit confused :)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 9, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691993733, 'comment_body': 'Got it, I think the inputs should be extension-specific right? because these can come from other extensions as well.\r\n`i_mdu_rd` and `i_mdu_ready`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 10, 38, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'zeeshanrafique23', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 691998575, 'comment_body': 'Actually, I think we only need one of those for multiple extensions. Only one extension can be active at the same time, and the *_valid signal (e.g. mdu_valid) indicates which extension is active, so only that one should respond.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 10, 46, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692001592, 'comment_body': "But I guess it's really just a matter of taste. If we have one signal (i_mdu_ready) we will need to have an expression like `ext_rd = (mdu_valid & mdu_ready) | (ext2_valid & ext2_ready)` outside of SERV but if we have separate signals the same expression will be inside of SERV. So it doesn't really matter much in practice but I see a way to keep the number of pins down on SERV which I think is good", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 10, 51, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692006274, 'comment_body': 'Great thanks for the clarification.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 10, 59, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'zeeshanrafique23', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692116618, 'comment_body': 'This should also be "- mdu? (MDU=1)"', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 13, 35, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692118236, 'comment_body': 'I just realized that we need to move this generate block inside serv_top.v so that we can expose the extension interface for designs that uses serv_top directly instead of serv_rf_top (e.g. serving)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 13, 37, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'olofk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692122709, 'comment_body': 'Oh yes, this should be.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 13, 42, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'zeeshanrafique23', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692146727, 'comment_body': 'Done :)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 14, 8, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'zeeshanrafique23', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 692404303, 'comment_body': 'Resolved?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2021, 8, 19, 19, 1, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'zeeshanrafique23', 'type': 'User'}]
